instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> no power
threads.message:
Liquid damage on J4915 and has been removed for now. Also <CAPACITOR>C7778</CAPACITOR> was damaged and replaced. No other visible damage.
Green light on charger.

PPBUS - 12.56v
PP3V42 - 3.429v
PPVRTC - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - missing
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S4_X239</SIGNAL> - missing (should I have this?)
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS</SIGNAL> - 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> - Missing

<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.396v
L7560 - 3.342v

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> no power
threads.message: Is there power cycling on <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL>? The usual suspects apply, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>/50, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> termination resistors/traces. Check all rails for shorts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> no power
threads.message:
Hey Duke.

Nothing on <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL>.

S5 going into <CHIP>U8060</CHIP>, .011V on <SIGNAL>5V_S4_EN</SIGNAL>

Will check other things next.

Thanks.


Update-
Areas recommended check over and clean. Board is very clean. All TP's are still gold. No visible burnt traces or damage except for what I already specified.
Will check for shorts. When you say check all rails, do you mean main power rails and sub rails? (Everything on pg 68) Or just main power rails? Diode or resistance mode?

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> no power
threads.message:
Just any rails, but most of interest would be CPU stuff.  

Also you say green light on charger, but it must be orange!

threads.message:
Home now with 3 screaming kids on their vacation. Get to it in AM. Just wanted to know where to be checking. 
thanks for the help.
Have a good night/day.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> no power
threads.message:
The only part that was damaged physically on the board was J4915. That leads <SIGNAL>TO5V_S0</SIGNAL>, could that be fucking up S3?

?

This board is so clean I dont even know where to start. No shorts, checked all 1.5V/1.2V/1.8V/1.05V RAILS.
